intro: Cyrtandra ampla, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a fine pubescence. Cyrtandra ampla plays an important ecological role in its native environment, supporting local pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian flora.
